modules.description: Provides functions to create, extend, and inspect a buffer structure. Operates on a custom type `t` that wraps a `Bytes.t` value. Used to safely manage buffer growth, ensuring allocations stay within defined limits while initializing new memory with null bytes.

Reads lines from input channels into byte buffers with specified position and maximum length, including the newline character when present. Operates on input channels and byte buffers, returning the number of bytes read. Useful for parsing structured text data with controlled buffer management.

Provides functions to parse OpenSSL configuration files into a structured format, including hash tables and name-value stacks. Enables querying of configuration data through an abstract API without exposing internal implementation details. Designed for use in environments like unikernels where pure OCaml dependencies are required.

manages text data through buffer manipulation and line reading, using a custom `t` type for safe memory handling and input channel integration. It supports dynamic buffer expansion, null-initialized memory allocation, and controlled line reading with newline inclusion. Operations include buffer creation, extension, inspection, and line-based input parsing. Examples include safely building configuration files or processing log entries with precise memory control.
